I've been tinkering around with the graphical layout
for networks.  Ken has made a few suggestions along
these lines.

Here's the most recent version:

http://photos.groups.yahoo.com/group/neat/vwp?.dir=/&.dnm=Revised+Network+Graph.gif&.src=gr&.view=t&.hires=t

Hidden nodes are simply evenly distributed.  Input
nodes are blue, hidden green, and output lavender. 
Excitatory connections are black, while inhibitory
ones are in red.  The opacity of the connections are
related to the magnitude of their connection weight. 

There's probably not a need for a single standard
layout view...SVG files are easy to edit and
individual users can modify them to suit their
preferences.  But it would be nice to have a
boilerplate layout.  

Derek
